result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Erion Dmin Preston

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Erion Dmin Preston in court.  
Attorney Glenn Oswald Givens Jr in court for Erion Dmin Preston. 
Attorney Erika Strebel for  William R. F. Ackell in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Scheduling Conference. 
Defense in receipt of discovery and offer from the State and request a projected guilty plea date.
Defense advised to file the plea documents 24 hours in advance of the hearing,. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Plea hearing scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Received and filed: Justice Point Supervision Report.

ADJOURNED OFF THE RECORD VIA EMAIL.
Case calendared for a Scheduling Conference.
Court is in trial and case adjourned.
Parties advised of the new court date.
Case remains calendared in Branch 19.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Erion Dmin Preston appeared by video, in custody in HOC.  Attorney Glenn Oswald Givens Jr appeared by video for Erion Dmin Preston.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 19, Judge K. Ashley. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 19.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver

Attorney Glenn Oswald Givens in court by video, defendant Erion Dmin Preston not in court, in custody.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Mr Preston is in quarantine due to COVID. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Erion Dmin Preston not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Attorney Givens fail to appear. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No driving without a valid license.

ADDRESS INFO for Erion Dmin Preston
Current: 3038 North 22Th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53210   (Effective: 07-30-2022)
Prior: 3038 North 22Th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206
Oral No Contact Order with A. J. B. or co-actors.  Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Erion Dmin Preston in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Erion Dmin Preston in custody.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Erion Dmin Preston appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 6 and 7.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
